account_id.description: The identifier for the account that will send the transfer.

address_city.description: The city of the check's destination.

address_line1.description: The street address of the check's destination.

address_line2.description: The second line of the address of the check's destination.

address_state.description: The state of the check's destination.

address_zip.description: The postal code of the check's destination.

message.description: The descriptor that will be printed on the memo field on the check.

note.description: The descriptor that will be printed on the letter included with the check.

recipient_name.description: The name that will be printed on the check.

require_approval.description: Whether the transfer requires explicit approval via the dashboard or API.

return_address.description: The return address to be printed on the check. If omitted this will default to the address of the Entity of the Account used to make the Check Transfer.

city.description: The city of the return address.

line1.description: The first line of the return address.

line2.description: The second line of the return address.

name.description: The name of the return address.

state.description: The US state of the return address.

zip.description: The postal code of the return address.

$block: Check Transfers move funds from your Increase account by mailing a physical check.

$ul: **account_id**: The identifier of the Account from which funds will be transferred.
**address_city**: The city of the check's destination.
**address_line1**: The street address of the check's destination.
**address_line2**: The second line of the address of the check's destination.
**address_state**: The state of the check's destination.
**address_zip**: The postal code of the check's destination.
**amount**: The transfer amount in USD cents.
**approval**: If your account requires approvals for transfers and the transfer was approved, this will contain details of the approval.
**approved_at**: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date and time at which the transfer was approved.
**approved_by**: If the Transfer was approved by a user in the dashboard, the email address of that user.
**cancellation**: If your account requires approvals for transfers and the transfer was not approved, this will contain details of the cancellation.
**canceled_at**: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date and time at which the Transfer was canceled.
**canceled_by**: If the Transfer was canceled by a user in the dashboard, the email address of that user.
**created_at**: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date and time at which the transfer was created.
**currency**: The [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) code for the check's currency.
**deposit**: After a check transfer is deposited, this will contain supplemental details.
**back_image_file_id**: The ID for the File containing the image of the rear of the check.
**deposited_at**: When the check was deposited.
**front_image_file_id**: The ID for the File containing the image of the front of the check.
**type**: A constant representing the object's type. For this resource it will always be `check_transfer_deposit`.
**id**: The Check transfer's identifier.
**mailed_at**: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date and time at which the check was mailed.
**message**: The descriptor that will be printed on the memo field on the check.
**note**: The descriptor that will be printed on the letter included with the check.
**recipient_name**: The name that will be printed on the check.
**return_address**: The return address to be printed on the check.
**city**: The city of the address.
**line1**: The first line of the address.
**line2**: The second line of the address.
**name**: The name of the address.
**state**: The US state of the address.
**zip**: The postal code of the address.

**return_details**: After a check transfer is returned, this will contain supplemental details. A check transfer is returned when the receiver mails a never deposited check back to the bank printed on the check.
**file_id**: If available, a document with additional information about the return.
**reason**: The reason why the check was returned.
**returned_at**: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date and time at which the check was returned.
**transaction_id**: The identifier of the Transaction that was created to credit you for the returned check.
**transfer_id**: The identifier of the returned Check Transfer.
**status**: The lifecycle status of the transfer.
**stop_payment_request**: After a stop-payment is requested on the check, this will contain supplemental details.
**requested_at**: The time the stop-payment was requested.
**transaction_id**: The transaction ID of the corresponding credit transaction.
**transfer_id**: The ID of the check transfer that was stopped.
**type**: A constant representing the object's type. For this resource it will always be `check_transfer_stop_payment_request`.
**submission**: After the transfer is submitted, this will contain supplemental details.
**check_number**: The identitying number of the check.
**submitted_at**: When this check transfer was submitted to our check printer.
**submitted_at**: The [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date and time at which the check was submitted.
**transaction_id**: The ID for the transaction caused by the transfer.
**type**: A constant representing the object's type. For this resource it will always be `check_transfer`.
